variant.note: Preface to the Student Research Workshop Proceedings
variant.bodyText: We are pleased to present the proceedings for the Student Research Workshop at HLT/NAACL-03, combin- ing two conference series, Human Language Technology and the North American chapter of the Associa- tion for Computational Linguistics. This is the third NAACL student workshop, and the first HLT student workshop. This year’s workshop presents 10 full-length papers. After each presentation, a panel of senior researchers will provide detailed comments and feedback on the work. We would like to thank the panelists in advance. This year, in keeping with HLT’s wider scope, we encouraged submissions that crossed the boundaries between computational linguistics, information retrieval, and speech recognition. Our accepted papers rep- resent all of these research areas. This year, we received 12 papers from 6 countries. Each paper was reviewed by at least three researchers, at least one student and at least one non-student. Each review con- tained extensive comments to the author. We would like to thank everyone who submitted to the conference as well as the members of the Program Committee for their time and extraordinary effort.
variant.reference: Program Committee (student members marked with S): John Aberdeen, MITRE Corporation Greg Marton, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (S) James Allan, U. (S) David Pierce, U. at Buffalo, SUNY Michel Galley, Columbia U. (S) Jay Ponte, Google Warren Greiff, MITRE Corporation Izhak Shafran, AT&T Labs John Henderson, MITRE Corporation Noah Smith, Johns Hopkins U. (S) Alexander K¨oller, Universit¨at des Saarlandes (S) Nicola Stokes, U. College Dublin, Ireland (S) Costis Koumpis, Domain Dynamics Ltd. Meliha Yetisgen, U. Washington (S) Gideon Mann, Johns Hopkins U. (S) Chengxiang Zhai, U. Illinois
variant.bodyText: We would like to thank Gideon Mann and Alexander Koller, the chairs of the student workshop at ACL- 2002, for sharing their invaluable experience. Marc Light, our faculty advisor has been immensely helpful in sharing his experience and providing guidance. Finally, we would like to thank the organizers of the main conference for their help, in particular Eduard Hovy, Mari Ostendorf, Marti Hearst, and Dragomir Radev.
variant.affiliation: HLT/NAACL-03 Student Research Workshop Co-chairs: Costas Boulis, University of Washington Eric Breck, Cornell University Victor Lavrenko, University of Massachusetts, Amherst.
